docs.snippet: One of the more intriguing concepts to emerge in the N.F.L. recently was a suggestion that there should be an initiative for players to consider African-Americans as they pick agents and lawyers....
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the more intriguing concepts to emerge in the N.F.L. recently was a suggestion that there should be an initiative for players to consider African-Americans as they pick agents and lawyers.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column notes that while majority of NFL players are African-American, majority of their agents are white; holds that old paradigm and racial stereotypes must change for non-white agents to break into field and for players start choosing to be represented by them.

headline.main: Diverse Representation for Players, Without Regulation
headline.print_headline: Diverse Representation for Players, Without Regulation
